instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
Hi, this is my first post here, thanks for having me in this group ^^
I have  a 820-2879-b that was using a cheap knockoff battery, the magsafe light goes green and orange in turn repeatedly
tried replacing u7000, u6990, r5091, c7695, c7695. now the magsafe doesnt light at all

ppbus before replacing anything 1.5v
now : 0v

any idea where to check ?

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
Welcome to the group.

First post diode mode (red probe at ground) on F7040.
Also post voltages for U7000; pins 1, 2, 3, 12, 13, 9, 14, 15, 19, 20.
And exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 (NOT to ground).
Do you get 3V42_G3H?

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
f7040 : 0.44

if the read is 0.11 mv should i just say it 0v ? regardless of that, I will post the exact reading to be sure
U7000
pin 1 : not stable, 0.500-100mv
2 : 16.5v
3 : 3.9v
12 and 13 : 0 v
9  : 035.5 mv
14 : 0.39 mv
15 :  180-200mv
19 & 20 : 5v

resistance between 17 and 28 is 0, does it mean something is shorted? 
and no pp3v42_g3h

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
Nothing moves on the board without 3V42.
However, you should have 12.2V on PPBUS_G3H.

For the moment must get 3V42.
Start checking diode mode to ground at L6995.
If OK, check R6905 and post U6990 voltages.

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message: Hi, sorry for not updating, so I have pp3v42, I have smc_Bc_Acok too, sys_onewire is 0.7v, but still no green light at the charger

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
Please, post accurate information.
If you have 3V42, then pin 12/U7000 must have the same voltage!

"I have smc_Bc_Acok too"
"14 : 0.39 mv"
Doesn't look like you have it.

Re-post all U7000 basic voltages.
Check if SMC_RESET_L is present.

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
okay my bad, Im not focused..
U7000
pin 1 : 14.9v
pin 2 : 16.4v
pin 3 : 3.94v
pin 12 : 3.4v
pin 13 : 3.4v
pin 9 : 0v
pin 14 : 1.69v
pin 15:  0v
pin 19: 5.07v
pin 20: 5.07v 

smc_reset_l is present at 3.4v

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message: Post exact value (ohm scale, measured onboard) for R7080/81 and R7085/86.

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
Here is the value :
R7080 : 98.6 khom
R7085 : 0.472 Mohm

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message: And the other two resistors?

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
my bad, I thought by /, I can just write one

R7080 : 98.6 kOhm
R7081 : 63 kOhm
R7085 : 0.472 Mohm
R7086 : 337.4 kOhm

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
Values look good, so Q7080/85 should be OK.
I hope you measured the resistors onboard.

You also didn't post resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
"resistance between 17 and 28 is 0"
In such case, Q7030 is shorted.
Be sure C7025 is OK.

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
honestly, Idk what measuring onboard mean, I just probe the resistor on each end,  is that right ?

so the resistance between 27/28 is 20.7 ohm
resistance between 17/18 is 0 
tried replacing c7025, then the resistance between 17/28 become 3.6 ohm

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
"resistance between 17/28 become 3.6 ohm"
That means Q7030 is shorted.

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message: so yeah I check the q7030 is shorted, and just to play it safe, i replace q7035 too.., now there's no short, but resistance between 17 and 18 still 3.5 ohm..

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
"17 and 18 still 3.5 ohm.."
What do you expect, from schematic???

Do you get voltage at F7040 now?

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message: yeah i get 12.6v, but it always drop to 3.3v, then back at 12.6v, and drop again, cycling..

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message: with battery plugged in, the voltage is steady at 12v,

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message: I don't have pp3v3_s5, I checked at u7840, the pp3v3_s5_en is pulsing too

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
SMC detects a problem and cycles the power.
Check if other big coils pulse too.
Be sure no short on any secondary supply.
Also try to start in SMC bypass.

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
yep, the ppbus coil pulse too, the pp3v3_s5 coil pulse ranging from 5v to 200mv to 0 to 5 and the cycle continue
and no voltage on pp5v_s3 coil

smc bypass did nothing..

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
"pp3v3_s5 coil pulse ranging from 5v to 200mv"
5V at 3V3 coil???
Check on its DC side.

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message: im sorry, I don't quite understand what check dc side mean ?

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
so.., l7220 pin 1 and 2 is pulsing ranging from 5v-0v too
so does pin 1 of c7251

threads.title: 820-2879-b magsafe blinking green and orange light in turn
threads.message:
Check R7269/70, all traces and other resistors around U7200.
You may need to change the chip too.
